posts.title: A general doctor, often referred to as a general practitioner (GP),is a medical professional who provides comprehensive healthcare services. They focus on overall physical and mental health, managing a wide range of medical conditions and offering preventive care.

A cardiologist is a physician who’s an expert in the care of your heart and blood vessels. They can treat or help you prevent a number of cardiovascular problems. They can also specialize in specific areas, like abnormal heart rhythms, heart failure or heart problems you’ve had since birth.
A neurologist is a medical doctor who specializes in diagnosing, treating, and managing disorders of the brain and nervous system, which includes the brain, spinal cord, and nerves.
An Endocrinologist is a medical doctor who specialises in treating diseases related to hormones, including diabetes.
An ophthalmologist diagnoses and treats all eye diseases, performs eye surgery, and prescribes and fits eyeglasses and contact lenses to correct vision problems.
